strings.mission_desc1: Le Commandant Lodeon veut que j'aille dans la région du Chemin Profond. Il dit qu'on a trouvé la nouvelle arme pour combattre les Machines. Il a besoin que je la récupère.
strings.mission_desc2: La Machine attaquée, le transporteur a explosé et je me suis échappé avec l'étrange dispositif attaché à mon vaisseau. On m'a dit de l'amener à Negati, à mon commandant, Lodeon.
strings.mission_desc3: J'ai encore échappé aux Machines... Ça commence à sentir la chasse à l'homme. Ils doivent être à la recherche du Mécanisme des Anciens. En parlant de ce dernier, le Commandant Lodeon m'a envoyé dans le Labyrinthe. Je suis censé utiliser le Mécanisme des Anciens pour déverrouiller les bases de données anciennes Almadi. Lodeon croit qu'elles pourraient contenir des informations sur la façon d'activer le Mécanisme des Anciens.
strings.mission_desc4: J'ai débloqué les bases de données almadiennes et à présent, je sais comment activer le Mécanisme des Anciens. J'ai besoin d'aller au Noyau du Secteur Six et de trouver la forteresse almadienne, Paralisk. Au début de la guerre, les Machines ont occupé le Noyau et elles sont en train d'y faire quelque chose d'horrible. Ceux qui réussissent à s'échapper du Noyau parlent d'armées de sbires, d'installations massives de Machines et même d'anomalies temporelles. Je n'ai jamais eu une affectation aussi dangereuse auparavant.
strings.mission_desc5: J'ai rapporté le Mécanisme des Anciens à Paralisk et ça a réveillé Eweri. Eweri m'a raconté qu'elle sera capable de combattre les Machines si le Mécanisme des Anciens est débloqué avec les huit Clés. Elle a généré les Clés dans les régions autour du Noyau. Il faut que je les trouve.
strings.mission_desc6: Les Machines attaquent Tridenkor, Colowis et Mzenim, les régions les plus importantes du Secteur Six !
strings.mission_desc7: Je ne peux pas détruire les Machines, parce qu'elles contiennent le ??Decay. Je ne sais pas quoi faire.
strings.mission_desc8: Le nouveau plan consiste à extraire des données cryptées sur le ??Decay à partir du Labyrinthe. Pour ce faire, Eweri a besoin de prendre le contrôle du hub de traitement des données sur Silaar. Si cela devait réussir, je saurais les plus sombres secrets des Almadiens. Peut-être parmi eux se trouve-t-il celui dont j'ai besoin pour sauver le Secteur Six.
strings.mission_desc9: Par delà le temps et la lumière du Secteur Six existent d'autres Secteurs. Des tableaux accélérateurs et décélérateurs bâtis par les Almadiens permettent de de voyager jusqu'à eux. Le tableau décélérateur qui pourra m'emmener au Secteur Cinq est appelé le Haut Chemin. Il est inactif depuis des siècles, alors il me faudra aider Eweri à les activer.
strings.mission_desc10: Le Haut Chemin est actif et à présent, je peux voyager jusqu'au Secteur Cinq. Là, il faudra que je trouve le chef emprisonné du groupe de recherches du ??Decay. S'il n'y a aucun moyen de neutraliser le ??Decay, Techamer le saura.
strings.mission_desc11: Ça empire. Mon désespoir me m'éloigne de tout ce qui est juste. J'ai ordonné à Eweri de libérer Techamer de sa cellule dans Grille Blanche. Maintenant, je vais lui faire réaliser une expérience pour laquelle il fut emprisonné. J'ignore comment cela va finir, mais je ne vais pas m'arrêter. Je dois sauver le Secteur Six.
strings.mission_desc12: Bientôt, je serai capable de combattre les Machines. Il faut que j'attache des balises aux Machines, que je sécurise puis détruise neuf régions. Après cela, Techamer créera quelque chose qu'il appelle l'Infinité Brisée et je finirai l'invasion. Je sauverai le Secteur Six.
strings.mission_desc13: Des balises sont dans les Machines et les régions sont détruites.#Le Secteur Six est prêt pour la création de l'Infinité Brisée.
strings.mission_desc14: Les Machines sont piégées dans l'Infinité Brisée. Tout ce que j'ai besoin de faire, c'est de les détruire avant qu'ils ne s'échappent.#C'est la bataille finale.
strings.activity_desc1: Dans un infini fragmenté au delà du temps et de la lumière, une myriade d'instances se forme et s'efface, donnant l'existence à des réalités impossible.
strings.activity_desc2: Les Machines sont détruites ; il est temps de purger le Secteur Six de leurs sbires.
strings.activity_desc4: Un vortex temporel est apparu ! Oserez-vous y pénétrer ?

strings.dialog2: Great. This carrier holds the artifact that might help to end the Machine invasion.
strings.dialog8: Your mission is to destroy all minions in carrier's path.
strings.dialog9: Get carrier to my current location in Negati.
strings.dialog14: Someone from the carrier contacts you.
strings.dialog15: The Machine is going to shoot again! There's no other choice.
strings.dialog16: You will have to carry the artifact now.
strings.dialog17: Bring the Elder Mechanism to Negati. It will save Sector Six... I hope. Goodbye.
strings.dialog24: So that's why Commandant wants this artifact.
strings.dialog25: Could it really be the legendary Elder Mechanism?
strings.dialog27: Secondary power source detected.#de dégâts d'arme increased.
strings.dialog29: Just few more secondes... Damn it.
strings.dialog30: It's a powerful weapon, but can it stop les Machines?
strings.dialog35: What happened? Where is the carrier? Wait, what is that on your ship?
strings.dialog37: Let me guess, the carrier is gone?
strings.dialog38: Yes. We were attacked by the Machine. The carrier was destroyed, but I managed to escape. I think the Machine was trying to destroy the artifact. If it really is the Elder Mechanism...
strings.dialog40: That's what the carrier pilot called it.
strings.dialog41: You can't even imagine what you've got here. Quickly, send it to me... No, no, stop. Something isn't right. Let me check.
strings.dialog42: I knew it was too good to be true. It's broken. Or deactivated. Yes, they have turned it off...
strings.dialog43: Great... So much fighting for nothing.
strings.dialog44: You weren't fighting for nothing. We will activate the Elder Mechanism. I'll tell you my plan, but first, you need to know something. One of les Machines is following you.
strings.dialog46: It's getting closer! It will be here soon! Okay, we have a little time... Listen, do you know about Labyrinth?
strings.dialog47: Labyrinth? The region with the databases?
strings.dialog48: Yes, Almadian databases. They might contain the information about the way to activate the Elder Mechanism.
strings.dialog49: No one had opened them before and that's probably because the only thing that could open those databases is the Elder Mechanism. Go to Labyrinth, $$.
strings.dialog50: That's it, the Machine has entered the area! I'll try to slow it down, get out of here!
strings.dialog51: You are good at escaping les Machines. Now get those databases open.
strings.dialog57: We are Almadians. Long ago, our civilization was just like all other civilizations. It was torn by conflicts, clouded by ignorance. We had inhabited thousands of worlds, but still hadn't found peace.
strings.dialog58: The only thing that allowed us ascend above all others is time. We are from the oldest, slowest Sector. We existed before everything else. We had time to learn from our mistakes.
strings.dialog59: After we have achieved peace, we have discovered that our infinite Universe is just another layer, another Sector.
strings.dialog60: We have traveled to other Sectors, colonized them, found alien civilizations. It was incredibly painful to see them all making mistakes that we stopped making ages ago. We had to do something.
strings.dialog61: After the discovery of other Sectors, our power began to grow exponentially. We thought with that power, with the knowledge of the greatest secrets, we would be able to stop wars, suffering, chaos...
strings.dialog62: We built the Mechanisms of Light and unleashed them, hoping to change the future. And we did. But something went wrong. We made everything even worse. We have created the Decay...
strings.dialog63: First this anomaly was seen only in a few Sectors. Then it began to spread.
strings.dialog64: Everything fell apart. Nothing worked as it should. Darkness engulfed our minds and our worlds.
strings.dialog65: We had to act quickly. The Decay had spread to every Sector except the deepest eight Sectors. We had no choice.
strings.dialog66: We have collapsed all Sectors that were touched by the Decay...
strings.dialog67: Those who survived the collapse of their Sectors have risen against us.
strings.dialog68: They called themselves Shatterers. Their goal was to destroy our Sector, just like we destroyed their Sectors.
strings.dialog69: But our home wasn't just another Sector. If our Sector was destroyed, it would take everything else with it.
strings.dialog70: We prepared for war against the Shatterers. We built the Mechanisms, the Entity Chambers.
strings.dialog71: We wouldn't have needed them, but our enemy, fuelled by limitless hate has become a serious threat. Serious even to us.
strings.dialog72: They built their armada out of metals from cores of dying stars, they created les Machines and gave them ill, crippled intelligence. They sacrificed everything good in them to gain power equal to ours.
strings.dialog74: Sector Sept was devastated. Worlds melted, stars were taken, consumed as fuel for their weapons.
strings.dialog75: They defeated us there, but at what cost? Sector Sept could have been their new home. But their minds were fixed on the destruction of our home Sector.
strings.dialog76: It was dark times. We were weakened by the Decay that consumed our colonies. We were taking one attack after another, unable to defend. After centuries of peace, we had to fight in the biggest war ever to occur.
strings.dialog77: But every loss made us fight harder. We built new warships, awakened forgotten weapons, unleashed the forbidden Mechanisms.
strings.dialog78: It all ended when the Shatterers attacked Sector Six. We knew that if we failed this time, they would become even stronger and nothing would ever be able to stop them.
strings.dialog79: We redirected everything we had to Sector Six and with the help of Sector Six civilizations, we defeated the Shatterers. Before we pushed them to Sector Sept they managed to collapse Sector Six.
strings.dialog80: But the war was finally over. We have resurrected Sector Six, erased all Shatterers, and banished their Machines to Sector Seven. After that there was nothing for us to do.
strings.dialog81: The things we had to do stop the Decay and defeat the Shatterers have changed us. So much was lost and it all was our fault.
strings.dialog82: We have returned home and we will never leave it. Our time has ended.
strings.dialog83: We have put the Mechanisms to sleep and left them to guard les Machines. If the Mechanisms will be needed again, they must be taken to Paralisk in the Core of Sector Six to be activated.
strings.dialog84: Our enemy are the Shatterer Machines...
strings.dialog85: Too bad the databases didn't explain why les Machines are trying to destroy Sector Six.
strings.dialog86: Commander, I have unlocked the databases.
strings.dialog87: Did you found how to activate the Elder Mechanism?
strings.dialog88: I need to take it to Paralisk.
strings.dialog89: Paralisk? That's Almadian stronghold, it's deep in the Core.
strings.dialog90: I really don't want to send you there. But there's no better option.
strings.dialog91: I will break through, like always.
strings.dialog92: I hope you will. Good luck.
strings.dialog122_b: Move votre vaisseau with arrow keys
strings.dialog122_c: Move votre vaisseau with $$, $$, $$, and $$ keys
strings.dialog142: This looks worse than I thought it would. les Machines have completely devastated this place.
strings.dialog146: I am sure that this has happened before... But when?
strings.dialog147: This must be the Almadian stronghold.
strings.dialog154: Now that the Mechanism is active, I can finally talk.
strings.dialog157: The main function of what you call the Elder Mechanism is to keep me alive and to protect the Universe from my power. I am extremely dangerous to everything outside the Mechanism.
strings.dialog158: Can you stop les Machines, Eweri?
strings.dialog159: Yes. Almadians have created me to fight the Shatterer Machines. But the Mechanism needs to be active.
strings.dialog160: It was a nightmare getting here, don't tell me it's still not active.
strings.dialog161: Sorry, but the engines are still locked and I cannot do much to les Machines.
strings.dialog162: Then they need to be unlocked.
strings.dialog163: Elt. Lix. Paralign. Ullur. Endrawe. Xelrawe. Innex. Nuuril.
strings.dialog164: The Keys that unlock the engines have been generated in the nearby regions. I am not allowed to create them anywhere closer.
strings.dialog165: The engines let me manipulate energy outside the Mechanism, so if you want me to fight les Machines, you'll have to get the Keys and unlock the engines.
strings.dialog166: Then let's get out of the Core.
strings.dialog167: Hey, Eweri, ever since I raided the databases in Labyrinth, I was wondering about the Decay.
strings.dialog168: The Decay is the cause of so many horrible things, what exactly is it?
strings.dialog169: I don't know how much I am allowed to tell you, but...
strings.dialog170: When the Decay appeared, Almadians sent research probes into the decayed regions. They sent millions of probes, but only a few of them returned.
strings.dialog171: Each returned probe carried impossible data. At first, it seemed like the data was corrupted, but soon it was clear that the data was right. It was the Universe that was corrupted.
strings.dialog173: The Decay warps the very nature of the Universe. All that is constant becomes unstable and those instabilities spread faster than it should be possible.
strings.dialog174: The only way to stop the Decay from turning everything into the Decay is to cut the connections to it. That's why the decayed Sectors had to be collapsed. That's why Shatterers had to be killed.
strings.dialog175: I thought les Machines were the worst.
strings.dialog185: Eweri, I know it's not a good time to talk, but I need to ask you something. Can you really destroy les Machines?
strings.dialog187: You fought against les Machines in the war against Shatterers, why didn't you destroy them?
strings.dialog188: I don't know, $$. I was created, and then I was thrown into biggest war the Universe had seen... When it ended, I was deactivated. I think Almadians left me with les Machines in Sector Seven.
strings.dialog189: But that means that the invasion of Sector Six, countless deaths, destruction... It all could have been prevented!
strings.dialog190: Maybe. But this time I won't be deactivated.
strings.dialog191: It's bad right now, but it's about to be over.
strings.dialog194: Do you remember what happened before you were awakened in the Core?
strings.dialog195: Barely. While the Elder Mechanism is inactive, I can't think, I can't feel, I am just an automatic system. What I did back then, I did automatically.
strings.dialog197: You were looking for knowledge in Labyrinth, so I retrieved important data from them.
strings.dialog198: You were fighting the Machine minions in Negati, so I synchronized weapon systems with the Mechanism.
strings.dialog205: I can, but... You need to be prepared to fight les Machines and being able to destroy minions like that won't make you into a better fighter.
strings.dialog209: Commander, I have activated the Elder Mechanism. Allow me to introduce you to Eweri.
strings.dialog211: I am Eweri, I am the Entity of the Mechanism.
strings.dialog212: Ah, pleased to meet you. I am Commandant Lodeon of the Negati Armada.
strings.dialog213: There was some data about the Elder Mechanism being alive, but I never believed it.
strings.dialog214: Don't doubt it, I am alive.
strings.dialog215: I know what question you want to ask me. The answer is yes. I can fight les Machines and with $$'s help even destroy them.
strings.dialog216: Right now we're on the mission to unlock full power of the Mechanism.
strings.dialog217: That's great news! But hurry, les Machines have become more aggressive since you have returned from the Core.
strings.dialog218: Les Machines know I am awake. They will do everything to stop us.
strings.dialog220: We won't. See you soon commander.
strings.dialog221: Aspil... My home region. Usually it looks better.
strings.dialog222: Not much left of it after the last Machine attack.
strings.dialog229: It's not destroyed, if you are asking about that.
strings.dialog231: My spaceship can take me to any place in Sector Six. I fought over the endless cities of Mzenim, I explored the great ruins of the Tarion, I saw the Broken Giants in Phasse...
strings.dialog232: I'm no longer worried just about Aco Soome, because now my home is not just that one planet. My home is the entire Sector.
strings.dialog233: I guess I understand what you mean.
strings.dialog234: I wonder who you were, before the Machine invasion. How did you end up fighting les Machines?
strings.dialog236: I will tell you some other time.
strings.dialog237: Well... When I was young, I was told, that I was bound to become a fighter.
strings.dialog238: Being a fighter before the Machine invasion was different than it is now. When the Aspil Armada invited me to become a fighter, I refused.
strings.dialog239: I didn't know that I have no choice. Something within my mind needs that sensation of danger, responsibility, the rapid decisions of life and death.
strings.dialog240: I tried to live a normal life, but it only made me suffer. I had to start using combat simulations.
strings.dialog241: It helped for some time, but eventually even the most advanced simulations became dull.
strings.dialog242: Nightmares of danger that I needed so much replaced my dreams and dreams replaced reality.
strings.dialog244: But before I lost myself completely, the invasion began.
strings.dialog245: I remember I was walking in a street. It was evening. Sky above my head lit up, but I thought it was just a hallucination.
strings.dialog246: Then I saw people dying, I saw bringers falling. I fled. The next day I joined the Aspil Armada.
strings.dialog247: I passed training, got my first spaceship and began to fight the Machine minions. Hallucinations left one by one and soon I was the best fighter in Aspil Armada.
strings.dialog248: Everything changed so quickly. les Machines crushed the Aspil Armada and those fighters who survived, including me, joined the growing Negati Armada.
strings.dialog249: I secured regions, led refugees out of war zones, and destroyed hundreds of the Machine minions... Until one day I was sent to protect the carrier of a mysterious artifact.
strings.dialog252: Ruins of Ityl. We shouldn't be here.
strings.dialog256: Oh... This is bad. Ityl is dead, its matter is completely dormant. We need to leave as soon as we get the Key.
strings.dialog259: Matter fusion facilities. They are forging new pièces for military spaceships.
strings.dialog260: That's why it felt so familiar. I like the radiation these structures emit.
strings.dialog262: Well, probably because I was created in a matter fusion facility. Being close to them makes me feel good.
strings.dialog263: And the radiation is very nice, so many colors, free particles, exotic ions, binary atoms... I wish you could see it.
strings.dialog266: Hmm... Then what is the biggest difference?
strings.dialog267: Well, you are made from atoms and I am made from naons.
strings.dialog269: Ask Eweri to tell you more?
strings.dialog270: But I think we should go get the Key.
strings.dialog271: Can you tell me how you were created?
strings.dialog272: I can try... It's hard for me to tell when exactly I began. Sometimes I think that I always existed in one form or another.
strings.dialog273: I just know that I was taken from the shadow of the Universe. From unimaginable emptiness outside it.
strings.dialog274: I was not who I am now. I was a fragment of something greater. I still remember that feeling of separation.
strings.dialog275: I still remember the soft voice of my creator. After I heard it, I no longer wanted to return from where I was taken. I wanted to become something and see the light.
strings.dialog276: I was brought into true existence as a naonic reflection of my creator. I woke up in Aco Veloom Tezari that shaped me. It was incredible.
strings.dialog279: I ripped Aco Veloom Tezari in half.
strings.dialog280: I only wanted to move a little. But naons are not good for atoms.
strings.dialog281: So I was put inside the Mechanism. If the engines of the Mechanism are active, I can influence everything that is outside it without causing too much damage.
strings.dialog282: This time you're going to need to cause some damage.
strings.dialog283: I am looking forward to it.
strings.dialog285: The Machine has devoured the Key!
strings.dialog286: I'll take us away from it!
strings.dialog287: We don't have to run from the Machine! With Sept of my engines active, we might be able to defeat it!
strings.dialog292: Lifeless abomination... This is your end.
strings.dialog294: The Machine threatens to break the Key if you will continue fighting.
strings.dialog295: What should we do, $$? Without one of the Keys, we might not be able defeat les Machines. But can we let this terrible thing continue destroying Sector Six?
strings.dialog296: Destroy the Machine? The Key will be lost.
strings.dialog302: Sorry, Eweri, but I have to destroy the Machine.
strings.dialog297: We must have all of the Keys to win this war.
strings.dialog298: Run, Eashor. We will meet again...
strings.dialog301: It is done. The Mechanism is now fully active.
strings.dialog321: Yes! Now we will win this war! Suffering will finally-
strings.dialog312: $$, Eweri! les Machines are attacking! They are headed towards Colowis, Mzenim and Tridenkor. They want to crush the last resistance. I cannot stop them.
strings.dialog327: I still don't understand what are les Machines doing in Sector Six.
strings.dialog328: The Shatterers are gone and les Machines don't have a free will, they couldn't have decided to attack Sector Six by themselves.
strings.dialog329: Maybe some of the Shatterers survived?
strings.dialog330: No, that's impossible. Everything that was from collapsed Sectors were erased from the Universe.
strings.dialog332: It's not the only thing that worries me about this situation.
strings.dialog333: Les Machines and their minions are not trying to occupy Sector Six. They are methodically breaking everything down. They are trying to empty Sector Six. But for what reason?
strings.dialog334: If les Machines wanted to attack Almadian Sector, Negati Armada couldn't stop them.
strings.dialog337: I'm afraid that this is more than invasion.
strings.dialog338: We don't need to know why it's happening. We just need to stop it.
strings.dialog341: Be careful, I am getting anomalous results from my sensors.
strings.dialog343: It appears that there are multiple intertwined temporal fields nearby.
strings.dialog344: We should leave this area. Unless...
strings.dialog346: We could go right where the temporal fields connect. I think it would take us to a different timeline.
strings.dialog347: Do you think it's worth the risk?
strings.dialog348: If you will enter Vortex temporel story missions and regions will be reset. Region levels will increase by 30.
strings.dialog349: You will also lose access to activities and Restoration War reward.
strings.dialog354: We're being crushed by the Machine! I'll have to order to retreat if I'll keep losing ships. Do something!
strings.dialog356: This shield will protect your armada from the Machine attacks.
strings.dialog357: Great, maybe I can save at least some of my bringers.
strings.dialog358: $$, take me to the Machine. It's time to end this nightmare.
strings.dialog365: Go after it! It's going to Colowis!
strings.dialog366: Colowis is overrun by powerful minions! $$, you'll have to protect it until I'll secure Tridenkor.
strings.dialog368: If you will attack the Machine now, minions will devastate the region.
strings.dialog371: This region is the last thing it will scar!
strings.dialog373: Okay, then we will destroy you instead!
strings.dialog382: We can still get to it!
strings.dialog383: You can't, Mzenim has been attacked, we are needed there!
strings.dialog385: Don't let the Machine escape this time.
strings.dialog386: Les Machines know I can defeat them. They are going to hit and run, again and again... I know this tactic.
strings.dialog389: I will pin les Machines to this dimension. They will not be able to leave it.
strings.dialog390: When that will happen, les Machines will hit us with everything they got.
strings.dialog392: You need to leave, commander. This is not a fight your Armada can endure.
strings.dialog393: Understood. I will start the evacuation.
strings.dialog395: That's it, I've done all I can. Negati Armada will leave the region soon.
strings.dialog404: The Machine has the Decay inside! If you will destroy it, the Decay will be released!
strings.dialog411: But that means... That means we cannot save Sector Six.
strings.dialog412: I'm sorry, $$. There's nothing I can do.
strings.dialog418: I will fight even there is nothing I can do to make things better.
strings.dialog419: I don't need hope to fight. I can just... Fight.
strings.dialog422: How did Almadians defeat les Machines during the Shatterer War?
strings.dialog423: We killed the Shatterers and les Machines became inactive. Without orders, they don't do anything.
strings.dialog424: That means some of the Shatterers survived.
strings.dialog425: No, I think les Machines no longer need orders from the Shatterers... They have malfunctioned. Or maybe the Decay have warped their sentience.
strings.dialog426: Then we need to find a way to contain the Decay after we destroy les Machines.
strings.dialog428: You did not know about the Decay in les Machines. Maybe you don't know something else about the Decay.
strings.dialog430: We need to know everything Almadians knew about the Decay.
strings.dialog431: That knowledge is probably in Labyrinth with the darkest Almadian secrets. Protected by many layers of encryption and spread across all databases.
strings.dialog432: It's too much even for me.
strings.dialog433: What if you had control of all data devices in Sector Six? Would that be enough to get the information we need from Labyrinth?
strings.dialog434: Probably. But how could I do that?
strings.dialog435: There's data processing hub in Silaar, it is connected to all data devices on Sector Six.
strings.dialog436: Okay, take me to Silaar and I'll see what I can do.
strings.dialog437: Silaar. Aspil Armada was destroyed near those structures. Just looking at them makes me feel sick.
strings.dialog438: It was the early days of the invasion. We went to destroy a small swarm of minions.
strings.dialog439: We were doing fine. I took down veteran and heavy, other minions were smaller. We were supposed to win.
strings.dialog440: Then one of les Machines appeared. I don't think you've seen that one.
strings.dialog441: After Cinq secondes most of the fighters were dead. I managed to get close to the Machine. I didn't knew how powerful these things are. Nobody did.
strings.dialog442: I burned six thousand ether, but the Machine didn't even react to my attacks. It was invulnerable. And it was crushing Aspil Armada with such arrogance.
strings.dialog443: It didn't care to aim properly. That thing knew it was going to win.
strings.dialog445: I remember bravery and hope in those early days. People of Sector Six were almost happy that someone dared to attack us.
strings.dialog446: It was chance for us to show how powerful and united we were.
strings.dialog447: We managed to defend Sector Six for a few days. Then we started losing cities, planets, entire regions.
strings.dialog448: There was no transition between our prosperous life and this hopeless fight.
strings.dialog449: And now I know... Even Almadians could not defeat les Machines.
strings.dialog451: I believed that you would save us, Eweri.
strings.dialog452: I don't know if you can imagine how I felt when my weapons infused with your power started tearing the Machine apart.
strings.dialog453: The end of my Universe was cancelled.
strings.dialog455: Now I don't believe anything. But that will not stop me.
strings.dialog456: And I will not let you stop fighting.
strings.dialog457: We have no right to give up.
strings.dialog459: Do you know who is Imeria?
strings.dialog460: She was Tetragon, one of the Almadian Armada's commanders. I heard about her.
strings.dialog461: Now my sensors recognize her as Nonagon. A guardian.
strings.dialog462: I think she looks after the things Almadians left in Sector Six.
strings.dialog463: Hm, I wonder what she will think about this.
strings.dialog465: Eron tessariome teracti.#This area is restricted.
strings.dialog469: Palinn vega ixanumex.#Attempting to eliminate intruders.
strings.dialog472: It's working! I am connected to everything, even Labyrinth.
strings.dialog474: Not again. What do you want now?
strings.dialog475: Entity, I demand you to disconnect.
strings.dialog476: Why would I listen to you?
strings.dialog477: The knowledge you are trying to acquire is forbidden.
strings.dialog478: Leave or I will be forced to destroy the hub.
strings.dialog479: Destroy it and I will destroy les Machines. Or just one. One would be enough, right?
strings.dialog481: You wouldn't dare to release the Decay.
strings.dialog486: So much data, it's getting difficult to focus.
strings.dialog489: What Almadians did to Sector Six after it was destroyed by the Shatterers was not resurrection.
strings.dialog490: It was reconstruction. Sector Six was turned into a weapon.
strings.dialog492: What this file says is unbelievable! There are programmed particles in every atom of Sector Six.
strings.dialog494: It's possible control everything in Sector Six with a special key. Absolutely everything.
strings.dialog495: Now I understand why Imeria didn't want us to have this knowledge.
strings.dialog496: This explains everything! Those strange minions that gather Sector Six particles are reprogramming them to obey les Machines!
strings.dialog497: Les Machines want to turn Sector Six into a weapon and destroy Almadian Sector!
strings.dialog498: So if we will not stop them the Universe is doomed. But we already know that.
strings.dialog500: I'm almost done decrypting the deepest database layers.
strings.dialog501: The knowledge about the Decay should be in them.
strings.dialog503: Hmm... I can't find anything useful. Just the official reports about the Mechanisms of Light and all that.
strings.dialog506: Wait! Apparently, there was a group of scientists that were experimenting with the Decay.
strings.dialog507: Results of their research have been erased and their leader, Techamer, was imprisoned in Sector Five. It says that he is not allowed to die, for some reason. Strange.
strings.dialog508: Then we need to Parler à him.
strings.dialog509: How can we get to Sector Five?
strings.dialog510: Through High Path. I think I have the permission to activate the old arrays.
strings.dialog513: Commander, we have received new information. We need to travel to Sector Cinq and find a new way to stop les Machines.
strings.dialog515: We cannot destroy les Machines because doing that would permanently damage the structure of the Universe.
strings.dialog517: And is much worse than it sounds. We'll be back as soon as we can.
strings.dialog518: You don't have much time. les Machines are still recovering from recent battles, but it won't take long before they start attacking again.
strings.dialog521: Tell me what to do, Eweri.
strings.dialog522: I need to enable decelerator stabilizers. There is one in the vicinity, find it.
strings.dialog524: Are you insane? We're fighting for the survival of the entire Universe!
strings.dialog525: The knowledge that you have stolen from Labyrinth will end everything much faster than les Machines will.
strings.dialog526: You don't even know what I am doing!
strings.dialog527: But I know what will happen.
strings.dialog528: Okay, but you can't even stop us.
strings.dialog531: This wall is not supposed to be here.
strings.dialog532: That is Imeria's work. Remove it.
strings.dialog536: I can't, I don't have one of the Keys.
strings.dialog541: Here is one of the stabilizers.
strings.dialog543: It is done. Take me to the next one.
strings.dialog546: I'm trying to do the right thing. But it's too late.
strings.dialog548: About the Machine that you attempted to destroy.
strings.dialog549: I had to take it away, keep it stable.
strings.dialog550: After that, I tried to reach you.
strings.dialog551: I barely had time to tell you about the Decay inside les Machines.
strings.dialog552: You are always at the epicenter of war.
strings.dialog553: And now you are corrupted by the forbidden knowledge.
strings.dialog554: I have to stop you. But if I will stop you, les Machines will win.
strings.dialog555: No, I can't. I can't do any of this.
strings.dialog558: I am tethered to Paralisk. I cannot die.
strings.dialog561: I have no choice and I won't let you have one.
strings.dialog573: No! You cannot have a choice!
strings.dialog574: Maybe there's something else I can do.
strings.dialog582: This stabilizer is protected by laser grid!
strings.dialog583: I have disabled it, but it will activate itself soon. Hurry!
strings.dialog592: Through this access line, we can get to Techamer's cell.
strings.dialog593: Prepare to fight, White Grid has activated its defense units.
strings.dialog595: There are thousands of those cells.
strings.dialog596: They are for Shatterer supporters, malfunctioned weapons, traitors, decayed objects.
strings.dialog599: The cell we are looking for is in the middle of this grid horizon.
strings.dialog604: Hello! Who am I talking to?
strings.dialog605: I am $$, fighter of the Negati Armada.
strings.dialog606: Negati? That's in Sector Six, right?
strings.dialog609: I am Eweri. One of the Naonic Entities.
strings.dialog612: The Shatterer Machines have invaded Sector Six and are destroying it.
strings.dialog613: We need to stop them without unleashing the Decay.
strings.dialog616: Free me and I will try to help you.
strings.dialog617: Before I was imprisoned, I tried to perform my biggest experiment. Almadians have found out about my plans, killed my assistants and locked me up.
strings.dialog618: If I would perform that experiment, a lot would be revealed about the nature of the Decay.
strings.dialog619: Maybe with that knowledge, I would be able to help you.
strings.dialog623: Almadians wouldn't have imprisoned him without a good reason.
strings.dialog624: Yes. We have to do this.
strings.dialog627: I am finally free! I spent thousands of years in that cell.
strings.dialog629: I was afraid that Almadians would kill me, so I inserted the Decay Chamber inside my body.
strings.dialog630: If I died, it would release the Decay, so they made sure I couldn't die.
strings.dialog631: And yes, I was inspired by les Machines to do that.
strings.dialog632: Now I know how bad of an idea that was. But because of that, I understand your problem very well.
strings.dialog633: So what do you need for your experiment?
strings.dialog634: I need a quiet, empty region, far from Nonagon sensors.
strings.dialog635: Then we have to return to Sector Six.
strings.dialog636: So that's how it looks like.
strings.dialog638: Go to White Grid. That's where he is imprisoned.
strings.dialog639: Techamer, there is something that bothers me.
strings.dialog640: How did you get the Decay to make your Chamber? Wasn't the Decay destroyed by Almadians with all those Sectors?
strings.dialog641: Are you sure you want to know that? It's forbidden knowledge. You know the punishment for having it.
strings.dialog643: Complete deletion from existence, including everything that was in contact with you after you have acquired that knowledge.
strings.dialog645: Yes. Almadians are willing to erase entire worlds to keep that information hidden.
strings.dialog646: It was worse for me. I was imprisoned for thousands of years and I couldn't even lose my sanity.
strings.dialog647: I'm not afraid. Almadians can't know that I have that knowledge.
strings.dialog648: Yes, as long as you don't enter the range of the neural scanner.
strings.dialog650: It would detect forbidden knowledge within your mind and alert Almadians.
strings.dialog651: There was one of those terrible things in Scrambler Belt. It's probably dormant, so you should be safe.
strings.dialog652: So, do you still want to know?
strings.dialog653: Do you still want to know?
strings.dialog655: The truth is that Almadians did not eliminate the Decay when decayed Sectors were collapsed.
strings.dialog656: Those Sectors were too warped to be destroyed completely. They still exist in their decayed state.
strings.dialog657: The Decay is there and it's spreading through remaining connections.
strings.dialog658: Almadians have closed all physical connections to decayed Sectors, but non-physical connections still exist.
strings.dialog661: The informational connection is easy to explain. If you know about the Decay, you become decayed. Then everything you touch or think about also becomes decayed.
strings.dialog663: I have found out that the existence of the Decay at any point in time allows the Decay to spread through all temporal planes.
strings.dialog664: To get the Decay I needed, I have built a device that stores and replicates decayed information.
strings.dialog665: That is a very powerful informational connection and I was able to attract enough of the Decay to create the Decay Chamber.
strings.dialog666: I believe that the Shatterers did the same.
strings.dialog667: Wait, if the Decay spreads through time, doesn't that mean that everything is decaying?
strings.dialog668: It does. The only way to stop the temporal spread is to destroy time itself.
strings.dialog669: Fortunately, it will take millions of years for the Decay to gain critical presence through the non-physical spread.
strings.dialog672: Let's talk about the experiment then.
strings.dialog673: What are you going to do?
strings.dialog674: I have a theory that it's possible to use the Decay to transform matter without decaying it.
strings.dialog675: To confirm it, I need to simulate the Decay and use it to warp this area. While we were traveling, I have assembled the projector that will create the simulation, so we can start now.
strings.dialog678: As I said, it would be best to perform the experiment in an empty area.
strings.dialog679: That's why I have taken you here. Let's do this.
strings.dialog690: When I will activate the projector, you will have to move through the simulated Decay and collect samples.
strings.dialog693: I will keep altering the simulation to get the required data. All you need to do is move forward.
strings.dialog694: Eliminate or avoid any obstacles you will encounter.
strings.dialog695: If votre vaisseau will get destroyed, we will have to restart the simulation, so don't make mistakes.
strings.dialog708: This was like the Core, but worse.
strings.dialog709: Did you get what you needed?
strings.dialog710: Yes, my theory was partially correct. I know what to do.
strings.dialog712: Using the Decay I can do things that not even naonic entities can do.
strings.dialog713: I will create a new Sector, a new infinity.
strings.dialog714: Then I will break it to get accessible instances, that have no physical connections to Sector Six.
strings.dialog715: In those instances, you will be able to destroy les Machines without decaying Sector Six.
strings.dialog716: Are you sure that it will work?
strings.dialog717: Yes. Creating a stable disconnected infinity is simple. All I need is energy and now I know how to synthesize it using the Decay.
strings.dialog724: If something will not work, you will pay for it.
strings.dialog725: You will be taken to a place that is much worse than White Grid. And you will never get out of it.
strings.dialog726: There can't be a worse place.
strings.dialog733: You can trust me. I will do everything to help you save Sector Six.
strings.dialog734: I dedicated my entire life to stop the Decay or at least use it for something good and I'm very glad that I finally got the chance to do that.
strings.dialog736: Thank you, $$, that means a lot to me.
strings.dialog737: Now, where was I? Eweri, I require Sector Six map.
strings.dialog739: Hmm... $$, you have to empty every area in Charred Link, Pulsar Vector, Bloom, Lumer Pass, Wacar, Venerion, Phasse, Nebula, and Spiral.
strings.dialog741: There have to be no particles in those regions or they will become decayed.
strings.dialog742: I'll have to completely destroy nine regions?!
strings.dialog746: I need to secure regions first, so civilians could evacuate.
strings.dialog747: Yes, do that. When civilians will leave, I will destroy the regions.
strings.dialog749: It's not enough to create an infinity. We also need to get les Machines there.
strings.dialog750: I will create eight beacons and you will need to attach them to each of les Machines.
strings.dialog751: Beacons will transfer les Machines to Broken Infinity once it is created.
strings.dialog752: Leave me here, I need to prepare.
strings.dialog753: Return once regions are empty and les Machines are ready to be transferred.
strings.dialog755: I know that you have no right to trust me, considering where you found me, but please don't think that I am evil.
strings.dialog757: $$, Eweri, what is the status of your mission?
strings.dialog759: To save Sector Six, I must destroy Venerion, Bloom, Lumer Pass, Pulsar Vector, Spiral, Charred Link, Wacar, Nebula, and Phasse.
strings.dialog761: Do you have enough influence to start immediate evacuation?
strings.dialog762: I suppose I could tell that les Machines are about to attack these regions in full force and do what they did to Wacar.
strings.dialog764: But I need to know what is happening.
strings.dialog765: We cannot destroy les Machines in Sector Six. Or any other Sector.
strings.dialog766: So, we will create a new Sector, pull les Machines into it and destroy them there. But we have to empty those regions.
strings.dialog767: That's all I can tell you, commander. The rest is forbidden knowledge.
strings.dialog768: I don't like how any of this sounds. But do what you think is right, $$.
strings.dialog769: You and Eweri have more power to change the outcome of this invasion than anyone else in Sector Six.
strings.dialog770: Anyway, you need to secure all areas in these regions for the full evacuation, so do that.
strings.dialog773: The last ship is about to leave.
strings.dialog775: It has left, you can begin.
strings.dialog777: $$, can you tell me about this region?
strings.dialog778: I don't want to destroy a part of your Sector without knowing anything about it.
strings.dialog780: This region is called Charred Link.
strings.dialog781: Through this region, spaceships travel between Eolutch and Pulsar Vector.
strings.dialog782: It was heavily irradiated when Eo, Eolutch's biggest star went supernova.
strings.dialog783: I like this region, I used to come here after battles.
strings.dialog788: Techamer, we're approaching one of les Machines.
strings.dialog789: Okay, I'm sending you a beacon assembler.
strings.dialog791: Just launch a beacon at the Machine and it will automatically dig into it.
strings.dialog792: Once the beacon is inside, the Machine won't be able to remove it or disable it.
strings.dialog795: Pulsar Vector, the region of a thousand pulsars..
strings.dialog796: Light of pulsars is being collected by millions of collectors. This region provides power to cities of many regions.
strings.dialog797: It's the only region, where energy is completely free.
strings.dialog798: Well, it used to be free, before the Machine invasion.
strings.dialog799: There used to be cities woven out of pure energy that would transform into anything their inhabitants needed.
strings.dialog800: I'll never forget that day when I visited Brilight, Vector capital world.
strings.dialog804: This is Bloom, also known as a garden region.
strings.dialog805: Warm rays emanated from green dwarf stars of Bloom makes plants grow at an incredible rate.
strings.dialog806: Produce grown in Bloom's orbital gardens provides food for half of Sector Six.
strings.dialog807: It's so horrible that we will have to destroy it.
strings.dialog812: Almost all of the lumer comes from Lumer Pass.
strings.dialog813: Region's worlds are rich with lumer, that is used to create ether generators and collectors.
strings.dialog814: Without Lumer Pass, ether will become very expensive.
strings.dialog818: Wacar is the first region that was attacked by les Machines.
strings.dialog819: Before les Machines reduced region's cities to rubble, it was a residential region.
strings.dialog821: Destroying this region means that it will never be rebuilt.
strings.dialog824: Venerion is one of the most powerful regions.
strings.dialog825: It is a center of this part of Sector Six.
strings.dialog826: It is home to billions, Venerion's alpha cities are as large as planets.
strings.dialog827: During ancient times, Venerion has colonized Lumer Pass, Pulsar Vector and Bloom.
strings.dialog828: These Trois regions have made Venerion extremely rich.
strings.dialog829: And now that wealth will turn into nothing.
strings.dialog832: Phasse is an ancient home of Phassian civilization.
strings.dialog833: Very little is known about it, these derelict city-ships are the only proof of its existence.
strings.dialog834: Phasse has a small population, most of the people here live off raiding Phassian ships and selling their pièces.
strings.dialog835: Destroying this region is losing something unique and ancient, a fragment of past.
strings.dialog836: I wonder if it will be possible to resurrect those ships.
strings.dialog837: If not, maybe it's better to not resurrect Phasse.
strings.dialog840: Nebula is a very special region.
strings.dialog841: It's the only place on Sector Six where it's possible to gather nemezium.
strings.dialog842: Nemezium particles come to Nebula with space currents from Ityl, from dilapidating Shatterer derelicts.
strings.dialog843: Nemezium is main material for creating many types of weapons.
strings.dialog844: Without Nebula Sector Six will become vulnerable.
strings.dialog847: Spiral is the largest residential region.
strings.dialog848: Spiral's beautiful and stable yellow stars are orbited by thousands of cities.
strings.dialog849: So many people will be left without a home.
strings.dialog850: Even if we'll stop les Machines, people of Sector Six will suffer for many years from now.
strings.dialog861: Hey, it's the same Machine that broke my Key!
strings.dialog862: It's still too damaged to defend itself.
strings.dialog863: Soon we will able to finish what we started.
strings.dialog865: I will come back when les Machines will be destroyed and resurrect everything.
strings.dialog866: Yes, but these regions will not be the same.
strings.dialog869: It's so difficult for me to destroy, $$.
strings.dialog870: I feel like this is my fault.
strings.dialog872: I was created to do the impossible. When I can't do something, I feel flawed, incomplete.
strings.dialog873: I was created to protect and I can't do that.
strings.dialog875: I can't fight les Machines and you can't stop the Decay.
strings.dialog876: Our enemies are much more powerful than us.
strings.dialog877: But we're still fighting and that is what matters.
strings.dialog878: I wish I had all of the Keys.
strings.dialog879: When I tear region apart, I damage myself. I don't have enough power to do it properly.
strings.dialog882: Just be careful, I'm not as perfect as I used to be.
strings.dialog884: If you are here, that means you're done?
strings.dialog886: The creation of new infinity will start in...
strings.dialog895: Eweri, do you understand this code?
strings.dialog896: It's a map of links between dimensions and my engines?
strings.dialog897: Yes, you have to create these links.
strings.dialog898: It will fragment this infinity and pull les Machines in it.
strings.dialog899: I tried to figure out a way to do this myself, but it's too complex for me.
strings.dialog901: No, I don't have access to one of the engines.
strings.dialog903: Ah, it's not a problem. Well, not a big one.
strings.dialog904: Let me make a new map.
strings.dialog905: Because you chose to sacrifice the last Keys to destroy Light Eater Eashor, les Machines will have eight armor extensions.
strings.dialog906: This excludes Light Eater Eashor. It will have no armor extensions.
strings.dialog908: All of my engines are active.
strings.dialog909: Because you chose to spare Light Eater Eashor in exchange for the last Key, les Machines will have Sept armor extensions.
strings.dialog910: Okay, fragment this infinity when you're ready.
strings.dialog912: Sector Six is under attack by les Machines.
strings.dialog913: Les Machines are massive automatic spaceships that came from the unknown location 68 days ago and started destroying everything.
strings.dialog914: You are $$, the best fighter of the Negati Armada.
strings.dialog915: You are here to destroy the Machine minions and secure the area.
strings.dialog918: The red bar is armor bar. Armor bar shows how much damage votre vaisseau can take.
strings.dialog919: This is alloy. Alloy can be used to repair armor. When armor is low, hold $$ to repair it.
strings.dialog920: This is the ability bar. It shows status of installed abilities.
strings.dialog921: This is ether. It is used to activate powerful abilities. Gain ether by destroying minions.
strings.dialog925: Commander, I have secured the area.
strings.dialog926: Good, now go to Deep Path.
strings.dialog927: I need you to retrieve a weapon that might be able to destroy les Machines.
strings.dialog1042: I made a minor breakthrough! Here's something for your hard work.
strings.dialog1043: One of these instances will reveal the source of the Decay. But not this one.
strings.dialog1045: Last simulation produced interesting results. And a few pièces.
strings.dialog1047: I can't predict what pièces you'll get, so good luck!
strings.dialog1048: If my calculations are correct, you'll get a good part soon.
strings.dialog1049: There's no limit on how much pièces I can get you this way.
strings.dialog1050: Experiment with this instance has failed. Clear another one for me.
strings.dialog1051: What now, Techamer? Will you close Broken Infinity?
strings.dialog1052: No, I am planning to run experiments here.
strings.dialog1054: I know you're going to be busy destroying the remaining Machine minions, but if you'll get bored, come to Broken Infinity.
strings.dialog1055: I want to you destroy les Machines again.
strings.dialog1057: I can resurrect them. Not completely, just enough to be useful.
strings.dialog1059: They have the Decay that is vital to my experiments.
strings.dialog1060: If you're still not convinced, I can help to get pièces for votre vaisseau.
strings.dialog1061: Within Broken Infinity, I can simulate, disassemble, and filter entire Sectors.
strings.dialog1062: Help me, and I'll try to create pièces for you
strings.dialog1064: But you're on your own, $$. I want to rest and repair the damage all these fights done me.
strings.dialog1065: Without Eweri, les Machines will have nine armor extensions.
strings.dialog1069: The Machine minions continue the work of their masters.
strings.dialog1071: I am no longer Commandant of Negati Armada.
strings.dialog1072: Now I am Lord Protector of Restoration War.
strings.dialog1074: That's the official name for the fight against the remaining Machine minions.
strings.dialog1076: Negati Armada is being reformed, you're no longer a part of it.
strings.dialog1077: You're above everything now. No one can give you orders now, not even me.
strings.dialog1078: I do hope that you will still help me protect Sector Six against current and future threats.
strings.dialog1081: Together we will restore Sector Six to its former glory.
strings.dialog1082: Look for contested regions. Areas in contested regions are scaled to your level.
strings.dialog1084: To make it evolve into a more powerful minion, don't use compétences d'attaque.
strings.dialog1085: Remember: The more powerful minion is, the better rewards you will get for destroying it.
strings.machine_message4: Vous avez détruit half of them

strings.topic_desc1: Some of the pièces can be rotated by moving the cursor over them and pressing $$.
strings.topic_desc2: You can lock items by moving the cursor over them and pressing $$. Locked items cannot be sorted, dismantled, and sold.
strings.topic_desc3: Need alloy? Dismantle pièces by moving the cursor over unwanted items in inventory and pressing X.
strings.topic_desc4: Spaceship pièces come in 7 grades: Generic pièces, optimized pièces, advanced pièces, fractal pièces, mythical pièces, etalon pièces, and relic pièces. The higher grade part is, the more rare and powerful it is.
strings.topic_desc5: Grade 1 - Generic pièces: 2 properties, no amplifier slots. Color code: White.
strings.topic_desc6: Grade 2 - Optimized pièces: 2 properties, 1 amplifier slot. Color code: Yellow.
strings.topic_desc7: Grade 3 - Advanced pièces: 3 properties, 1 amplifier slot. Color code: Electric blue.
strings.topic_desc8: Grade 4 - Fractal pièces: 4 properties, 1 amplifier slot, can be set components. Color code: Blue.
strings.topic_desc9: Grade 5 - Mythical pièces: 5 properties, 2 amplifier slots, can be set components, can have wave chance properties. Color code: Purple.
strings.topic_desc10: Grade 6 - Etalon pièces: 6 properties, 2 amplifier slots, can be set components, can have wave chance properties, can boost ability levels. Color code: Red.
strings.topic_desc11: Grade 7 - Relic pièces: Unique properties, cannot have scaling properties, can have wave chance properties, can boost ability levels. Color code: Orange.
strings.topic_desc12: Maximum armor property: Increases maximum armor by X. Armor is spaceship's health: It decreases when the spaceship takes damage and 0 armor means that the spaceship is destroyed. The amount on a part: 250 per part level. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc13: Weapon damage property: +X weapon damage. Weapon damage determines how much damage the spaceship does. It is used by abilities and various effects. Only weapons can have this property. The amount on a part: 100 per part level. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc14: Maximum ether property: Increases maximum ether by X. Maximum ether determines how much ether the spaceship can have. Ether is consumed to activate abilities. The amount on a part: 50 + 10% per part level. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc15: Initial ether property: X initial ether. Initial ether determines how much ether the spaceship will have at the start of the mission. Ether is consumed to activate abilities. The amount on a part: 50 + 10% per part level. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc16: la génération d'éther property:  Generates X ether on kill. la génération d'éther determines how much ether the spaceship will generate whenever it détruit an enemy. Ether is consumed to activate abilities. Scaling: 10 + 10% per part level. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc17: Armor generation property:  Generates X armor on kill. Armor generation determines how much armor the spaceship will generate whenever it détruit an enemy. Armor is spaceship's health: It decreases when spaceship takes damage and 0 armor means that spaceship is destroyed. Scaling: 25 per part level. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc18: Experience boost property:  +X% d'expérience. Experience boost Augmente the amount of experience the spaceship gains by destroying enemies. Experience is required to level up. Scaling: None. Cap: 200%.
strings.topic_desc19: Deflect chance property: +X% de chances de dévier les projectiles ennemis. Augmente chance to deflect les projectiles ennemis when they hit the spaceship, which prevents it from taking damage. Scaling: None. Cap: 80%.
strings.topic_desc20: Damage reduction chance property: Réduit les dégâts subis by X%. Scaling: None. Cap: 80%.
strings.topic_name21: la vitesse de charge de phase
strings.topic_desc21: la vitesse de charge de phase property: Augmente la vitesse de charge de phase by X. Entering phase Augmente de dégâts d'arme based on de dégâts de phase property. The spaceship will enter phase after taking a certain amount of damage. This property decreases the amount of damage the spaceship needs to take to enter phase. Scaling: None. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc22: de dégâts de phase property: +X% de dégâts de phase. Entering phase Augmente de dégâts d'arme based on de dégâts de phase property. Scaling: None. Cap: None.
strings.topic_desc23: Stunning wave chance property: +X% de chances de causer stunning wave. Augmente chance to cause a stunning wave whenever the spaceship détruit an enemy. It stuns all minions in range for 3 secondes. Scaling: None. Cap: 100%.
strings.topic_desc24: Damaging wave chance property: +X% de chances de causer damaging wave. Augmente chance to cause a damaging wave whenever the spaceship détruit an enemy. It Inflige 100% of de dégâts d'arme over 10 secondes à tous les sbires in range. Scaling: None. Cap: 100%.
strings.topic_desc25: Shredding wave chance property: +X% de chances de causer shredding wave. Augmente chance to cause a shredding wave whenever the spaceship détruit an enemy. It Retire 20% d'armure à TOUS les sbires in range. Scaling: None. Cap: 100%.
strings.topic_desc26: Upgrade chance property: +X% de chances to upgrade dropped part. Augmente chance to upgrade part dropped by a destroyed enemy to a higher grade. Does not apply to purchases and mission rewards. Scaling: None. Cap: 100%.
strings.topic_desc27: Core attributes are l'armure maximum, l'éther maximum, and de dégâts d'arme.
strings.topic_name28: le coût en éther de la compétence
strings.topic_desc28: le coût en éther de la compétence is determined by ability's type, base ether cost, and ether cost modifier. Ether cost modifier is affected by Flow Stagnation difficulty modifier, allocated ability points, and certain relics. Allocated ability points increase le coût en éther de la compétence modifier by 10% per point. Attack, shield, and shield removal abilities are not affected by ether cost modifier.
strings.topic_desc29: Ability cooldown is determined by ability's type, base cooldown, and cooldown modifier. Cooldown modifier is affected by certain relics. Attack, shield, and shield removal abilities are not affected by cooldown modifier.
strings.topic_desc30: pièces compressées are pièces with doubled properties that require twice as many part and weapon slots to be installed. They can be created by dragging and dropping modules de compression on pièces. Dropping a compression module on an already compressed part doubles its properties and slot requirements again, creating a super compressed part. pièces compressées are used to reduce the spaceship size.
strings.topic_desc31: When a part becomes altered, it receives one additional scaling property. Altered part properties scale based on part's level and alteration level. Highest level altered pièces require Ascension level to be installed. The chance to get altered pièces Augmente from 0% to 10% after the story is completed.
strings.topic_desc32: Some pièces have amplifier slots: They can be upgraded by dragging and dropping amplifiers on them.
strings.topic_desc33: Crafting items are amplifiers, cathodes, anodes, and modules de compression. They can be bought from vendors or rewarded for increasing difficulty, completing missions, and securing regions
strings.topic_desc34: Some secured regions have vendors: Connect to them to buy and sell items.
strings.topic_desc35: Le conteneur d'alliages are special items that can be installed by dragging and dropping them into container slot. Le conteneur d'alliages hold alloy - a resource obtained by dismantling items. Use alloy from installed Le conteneur d'alliage to repair the spaceship during a mission by holding $$. One alloy Répare 1% d'armure.
strings.topic_desc36: Eternal Le conteneur d'alliages are indestructible and gain alloy after a failed mission.
strings.topic_desc37: Unstable Le conteneur d'alliages lose alloy when you activate repairing abilities.
strings.topic_desc38: Sacrificial Le conteneur d'alliages destroy themselves to save the spaceship when its armor drops to 0.
strings.topic_desc39: Ancient Le conteneur d'alliages gain alloy when the spaceship passes dust cloud.
strings.topic_desc40: Transient Le conteneur d'alliages disintegrate at the end of a mission.
strings.topic_desc41: Corrupted containers give no alloy when dismantled.
strings.topic_desc42: In siege missions, bulwark blocks with white symbols destroy nearby blocks, blocks with orange symbols destroy nearby blocks diagonally, and blocks with blue symbols contain loot. Loot blocks only spawn loot if they are destroyed with siege cannon missiles.

strings.compressed_weapon: Compressed: Uses 2 part and weapon slots
strings.super_compressed_weapon: Super compressed: Uses 4 part and weapon slots
strings.dialog1086: It seems like the signal is coming from Sector Five.
strings.dialog1087: No, not Sector Five, Sector Zero.
strings.dialog1093: Good chaos! How did that happen?
strings.dialog1094: I was activated in Paralisk de $$ to fight the Shatterer Machines.
strings.dialog1096: That's me. With Eweri's help, I have defeated les Machines.
strings.dialog1099: I need you in Almadi, Eweri. One of the naonic entities has been affected by the Decay.
strings.dialog1102: Forbidden knowledge laws have stopped being enforced for several hundred cycles now.
strings.dialog1106: It started after the Isolation was declared.
strings.dialog1107: You remember Almadi as a united super civilization working to fix the Universe.
strings.dialog1108: That Almadi is gone. After the Decay Crisis and the Shatterer War, Almadi had to change.
strings.dialog1109: It didn't change to the better. Now my Sector is a battlefield of conflicting ideologies, a graveyard of worlds, a space of chaos. As a former leader of Almadi, I made it my responsibility to repair as much damage as possible.
strings.dialog1110: I have found the Alliance of Almadi. The Alliance have worked to reunite Almadi for thousands of cycles and considering the circumstances, we have achieved a lot.
strings.dialog1111: I hoped that someday Almadi would become what it used to be and resume its fight against chaos.
strings.dialog1112: My hope was never as faint as it is now.
strings.dialog1113: The Alliance's enemies have defeated us in every front.
strings.dialog1114: The Conglomerate of Light have destroyed our greatest world, Red Grid is under siege by the Opposition forces, Primitivists have taken over Aco Verund...
strings.dialog1115: But worst of all, Swarms of Decay have stolen Entity Taumavul, and have decayed him via information. He has activated himself and now he is a threat to the entire Universe.
strings.dialog1116: His intellect has been tainted with greed. He wants everything and he will never stop.
strings.dialog1117: Simulations predict that Taumavul will activate his Time Engine and trap everything in stagnated time to protect what he owns from entropy. You must help us.
strings.dialog1118: The end of the Universe... Alright, we will be there.
strings.dialog1119: You should stay in your Sector, $$. Almadi is not Sector Six, our spaceships are different, I don't think you'd be able to control them.
strings.dialog1120: No, you want $$ as well. $$ is a vanadian.
strings.dialog1123: Your condition, $$. You don't know how special you are.
strings.dialog1124: Well, in any case, I want to fight.
strings.dialog1126: My hope is resurrected. If there's someone who can save Almadi, it's you two. Naonic entity and vanadian, fighting together... Looks like I haven't run out of luck yet.
strings.dialog1128: Permission to access Sector Zero granted.

strings.topic_desc43: Relays + Strike ability: Each relay Libère a missile.#Relays + Flurry ability: Libère 2 missiles from the left side of the screen.#Relays + Unload ability: Each relay Libère a mine. Mines pierce enemies and shields.#Mine damage is halved.
strings.topic_desc44: Pylons + Strike ability: Each pylon Libère 4 missiles. Missile damage is halved.#Pylons + Flurry ability: Each pylon Libère a missile.#Pylons + Unload ability: Each pylon Libère release an immobile mine.#Mines seek enemies when detonated.
strings.topic_desc45: Nodes + Strike ability: Crée wave that Inflige damage to all enemies in range. Wave damage is halved.#Nodes + Flurry ability: Each node Crée a mine at the bottom or top of the screen.#Nodes + Unload ability: Each node Libère release a mine.
strings.topic_desc46: There are 7 part sets, each has a unique effect. Installing 6 pièces of the same set - set components - will allow activating that set's effect. Only grade 4-6 pièces can be set components. Set components are not stronger than regular pièces and installing more than 6 set components does not affect set's effect in any way.
strings.topic_desc47: Compressed and super pièces compressées require multiple part slots, but increase physical part count only by 1 when installed. Certain effects are based on the number of pièces physiques installées.
strings.topic_desc48: Engines are spaceship pièces with properties identical to non-weapon pièces - sections - and with unique engine skins. If the spaceship has less than 1 engine installed, its movement speed will be reduced by 50%. Other than that, engines do not have unique effects - having more than 1 of them will not make spaceship faster.
